body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT,
Frankfort, Dec 25th, 1860.
Brig Genl J. S. Gault
Dear Sir

From the In reading over this moment ^a correct copy I supposed to^ the letter I sent in answer to yours, offering the services of your gallant regiment, I perceive the following sentences were by mistake ^or inadvertently^ omitted I hope you will have them inserted in the proper place in my letter to you

When Indiana was threatened and invaded by a savage foe in days gone by the brave & chivalrous sons of Ky flew to the rescue from the torch the tomahawk & the scalping knife of the savage foe. ^Her people have been dear to us^ Her soil is baptized with the blood of our best citizens -- the bones of the eloquent and noble Joe Daviess and of others have consecrated the field of Tippecanoe & now in full remembrance of the past, where our homes, our constitutional rights, and our institutions are threatened with destruction, while I decline to accept it, the offering is most grateful to my feelings.
